Reviews.Title: “for 1 night only!”
Reviews.Author: Flora0207
Reviews.Content: If you have a little more money book somewhere else. I survived one night there but I would never book the room there. Doesn't look nice at all.

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: gamal13
Reviews.Content: Your WORST nightmare in Miami. The AC never worked after it was reported several times. The music from the night club on the first floor was so loud that we could not sleep through the night. Then at 5am you could hear very loudly the carbbage trucks and people cleaning the streets. We could not sleep at all that night. No light in the hallway at night and customer service was very poor. The breakast in the morning is a joke. The only great thing: its location. ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to make reservations”
Reviews.Author: Daniel A
Reviews.Content: We made reservations a few months prior to our travel. Called the day of our reservation to confirm. Upon arrival, we learned our room had been given to someone else. We reserved a family room as we have a family of 5. We were offered a 10% discount to take 2 beds (as this is all they had available). Since it was late, and we already had the taxi drop us off, we figured we didn't have any choice. We accepted the room, HUGE mistake, it had 2 twin beds for 5 people. The place was filthy and there was hair on our bed (not cleaned since the last person). We didn't stay, they can keep there filth and dishonesty... Not to mention this is a very terrible area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Devynn W
Reviews.Content: The room was horrible. Everything was dirty and really wanted to switch hotels the same day I arrived. Service was ok though. You are probably better off staying at a Super 8 motel or something along those lines.

Reviews.Title: “un hotel centrico y barato”
Reviews.Author: vecareca
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel many times. I will return again as the price is very good. Do not look for luxury there as the hotel is to sleep in only.

Reviews.Title: “no parking, manual elevator & bring your shampoo”
Reviews.Author: lucypost
Reviews.Content: We had to pay $24 nearby for overnight parking. Front desk at hotel had minimal information brochures & only 2 persons working; one at front desk and the other operating the manual elevator (you have to see to believe!) and also acting as the bellboy. It's quite a shock but it can be fun if you have a sense of adventure & for just shaking things up. I really felt sorry for the 2 overworked guys who seem to be doing the work of 5-6 persons. People running this joint better pay their employees. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: I just needed a place to crash before a cruise. The place is very bare-bones, but if you appreciate antiques for their historical value, this place is fine for the price. The room and bathroom were clean (although the bathroom was unbelievably small.) I wouldn't have noticed the size of the bathroom if it weren't for my rather tall friend's difficulties in there. Also it was a little noisy at night. However, the shuttle to the port and the location were phenomenally convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed to participate in the ING Marathon”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel that was, at all, reasonable priced. For the Marathon runners the hotel offered a free continental breakfast AND A FREE MASSAGE. The massage therapists, Linda and John, were awesome. It actually made for a very nice day after the 1/2 marathon. Thanks for having Linda and John there for us.

Reviews.Title: “nasty”
Reviews.Author: mam_macita_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on line, just like the other person who gave the review. AVOID AVOID AVOID, this is the worst place i have ever seen.i cried when i saw this room,the carpet was so dirty i was afraid to put my suitcase down, and the room smelled like urine.the door looked like it had been kicked in and patched up. the bed sagged in the middle.don't be fooled by the pictures on their web page because you are in for a rude awakening when you see what they really look like.i think any one who has been to this place should contact the health dept. and the hotel of commerence of florida and have them close this nasty place down. needless to say i did not stay

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cookiemonsta813
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Miami and of course I didn't know any better but this was by far the WORST hotel I have ever been to. From the minute I walked in I knew this place wasn't gonna be for me. From the rude service, the old elevator, and the smell in the hallways it was just horrible. I would never reccomend this place to anyone so please stay away and don't ever book a room without checking the reviews. Very dissapointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dive, it is old and run down.”
Reviews.Author: Julie E
Reviews.Content: The lobby is ok, all the furniture is from Ikea! The atm in the lobby was out of service. When we arrived there were 2 guys hanging out at the front door, looked like street people. Kindof creepy. They still use keys, not cards like most Hotels use now and the key chain said the room number right on it. (I don't like that) When we got to the room I took one look at it and thought "what a joke" The carpet is as thin as a penny. It is old and dirty. I had to go get towels from the maid because we had none when we got to the room. They did not have a rug in the bathroom so I put a towel down on the floor. After walking around the room I was doing my makeup standing on the towel when I stepped off the towel was black and I had just taken a shower. I told my daughter put on socks or wear your shoes while we are in the room. I took the towels and laid them on the carpet so we would not have to walk on it. Later when I asked for towels they only had one and said they were doing the laundry. In the morning the maid said they were still doing laundry and had no towels. The furniture in the room was also Ikea, the mattress was smashed in and small. Maybe a full size, I tried to see if the bed was from Ikea but did not see a tag. I felt very uncomfortable in this place and wasn't sure if we were safe of not. I would never recommend this place to anyone. We were on a budget and could not get a different Hotel. The internet did work in the room which was nice and the Front desk girls were nice. Those are the only things I liked about it. They also said they had a Airport Shuttle but when we arrived found out they did not. I really think this place needs to be shut down and needs major renovation. I also wondered if it was a pay by the hour hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: miamidaytrip
Reviews.Content: Booked a room online without reading the reviews...big mistake. Very dirty room. Something gross smeared on the wall. Spent the night sleeping with my hands under my head so I didn't touch the pillow. If its the last vacant hotel in Miami, save your money and sleep in the park or at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “THE NASTIEST PLACE ON EARTH. IS IT POSSIBLE TO GIVE 0 STARS?? AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eric p
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst, horrible, dirty, disgusting, nasty, horrendous place anyone could ever step foot into. I arrived at the Leamington Port of Miami October 12, 2011 to stay the night before the KISS Kruise. The first thing I noticed was right when I approached my room door. I could see through the crack of the door into the room. The door looked so old and cheap that even a child could kick it and it would swing open. As I walked into the room I was hit with a stench that reaked of mold and God knows what else. I tried to spray cologne and it didn't help. The floors looked that they had not been vaccumed in weeks and as I go to put by suitcase down I noticed that there was gum stuck to the carpet that looked black and hard or at least I hope it was gum, but the worst is yet to come... I decided to check the bathroom and the first thing I notice is that there is DRIED UP URINE ON THE TOILET SEAT and the shower curtains were very dirty. At first I tried to tell myself its just one night and I could wait to shower on the cruise boat. As I go to look at the bed sheets and guess what??? MORE URINE! That was it. I grabbed my suitcase and checked out within the first 30 minutes. They wouldn't refund me the money for the reservation. I have emailed the hotel owner and im awaiting a response to hopefully get a refund. This hotel is NOT worth any price no matter how cheap you think it is. Anyone who gave it a good review must have no sense of sight or smell because it was so unsanitary. Do yourself a favor put the extra money into staying at the Holiday Port of Miami down the street. The staff was very friendly and accomodating to me since they knew I was extremely upset about what just happend. The nasty pictures on this sight that other people posted while staying there are completley accurate and although I didnt witness or encounter bed bugs because I left I wouldnt doubt anyone that claims to have been bit is telling the truth. AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID. I'd sleep on the sidewalk in one of the alleys than sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “BY THE HOUR?”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: Homeless people everywhere, hand cranked elevator, took one look at the room and decided to waste the money we had to spend booking room online and called a cab! Inter-Continental is 2 blocks away and about $40 more bucks. Worth the money to stay there and not have to sleep with scissors under the pillow and luggage stacked at the door. VERY deceiving website and description online. SCARY! Don't even think about staying there! Was not even worth it for one night before a cruise!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kcc121
Reviews.Content: It's worth the money! Premium location! We did not expect 5-star service, given how much we paid for the one-night stay (right before the cruise trip). It's close to the port and very convenient location. Again, it's well worth how much you pay. The $60-ish included breakfast and free Wi-Fi so couldnâ€™t be better for the value. We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone with a budget...

Reviews.Title: “For the hotel location it wasn't what was expected.”
Reviews.Author: EmaLuscious
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a disappointment, i would not recommend it to anyone not even a homeless person for the money spent it was not worth it. Come on its located in the heart of downtown miami, they should take pride in their hotel. The elevator only worked during certain hours after hours we had to walk up flights of stairs.Most of the rooms didnt even have windows to see outside and parking is not offered for guests. It also could of been alot cleaner, im surprised we didnt have any unwanted quests, if you know what i mean.

Reviews.Title: “enter at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: KCGIRL21
Reviews.Content: I found this inexpensive, no amenities hotel close to the Miami port. It was cheap and provided a shuttle to our cruise ship. The review said it was a nice place to lay your head. That is if you take sleeping pills or drink enough to put you to sleep. Upon arriving we were greeted by the locals that live on the streets, they were hanging out at the 24 hour cafe across from our room. On a good note the front desk clerk was very pleasant. The hand operated elevator took us to our toom, kind of scary. There were four of us. We had adjoining rooms with one bathroom and a sink/mirror combo in the 2nd room. The bathroom was clean. The room resemble a very, very old dorm room. The locks on the doors looked as if any kid could break the door down. Maybe this was a rent by the hour hotel?? Luckily there was a flyer for pizza delivery so we didn't have to go searching for a restaurant. We had wine to help us sleep and kept the scissors or bottle openers under our pillows. For added protection we piled our luggage against the door! The all night outdoor noise of the cafe, people singing, someone kicking cans on the sidewalk and cars flying down the streets made for a restful night sleep, not. I would not recommend this hotel nor will I stay there EVER again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!”
Reviews.Author: Orsy03
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 8 nights with my mother. We wanted to save some bucks and booked the cheapest hotel saying that we'll definitely spend the whole time at South Beach. There were bed bugs so after 2 days we didn't really wanna go to the beach with so many spots all over our body. After that we bought a lot of different type of sprays such as Off so we could reduce the spots. We had a view of some kind of roof, the home of rats in Miami:) The air conditioner didn't work so we almost died at nights. Don't expect breakfast..there was always the same: toasts, strawberry jam, butter and coffee..and that's all:) ohh and there are no safes so we had to carry all valuable things with us to the beach too. There are a few advantages too..the staff was very friendly, i still keep in touch with them on facebook. It's just about 3 minutes walk from Bayside and Bayfront park and the bus stop is about 1 minute if you wanna go to miami beach. They change towels every day. So i definitely wouldn't go back, instead i would chose Holiday Inn Hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “this is the most nasty hotel around”
Reviews.Author: jedi8707
Reviews.Content: this is the most nasty hotel ever beds was never clean, floor was not clean, the internet never work while i was there. this hotel is a a bad place there was hoe out side and inside trying to make some money for themselves. the breakfast was so nasty i threw up every time. i think the state of FL should shut this place down for good...... i wish i never stay at this place..

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: DaveBoi
Reviews.Content: I can't believe we stayed at this place. Should have looked at the reviews. Tried to save a few bucks and it wasn't worth it. Booked 4 rooms for me and other family members. The rooms were small and poorly equipped. Beds were small and creaked. Very poor condition. Elevator is from the 1920s and requires a trained operator. Biggest issue: lack of proper A/C in all units. They say they have central air, but it doesn't work in most rooms. Some rooms in the hotel have window AC units and they work OK, but many rooms don't. The night we stayed there it was scorching hot outside and inside our rooms. After at first sending us to rooms with no AC, we complained and they moved 3 of us into rooms with AC window units. We were lucky that the place wasn't full. If it had been full we'd have been screwed. Other than that, one of our party had problems with an overflowed toilet and they also had to change rooms - 3 different rooms in the same night. Staff try to do what they can but their hands are tied.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: suzannekees
Reviews.Content: After staying in a terrific hotel in Chicago, for about the same price as the Leamington !! , we arrived at 01.00 am tired and we were very dissapointed with this hotel . In the morning we were told we couldn't use the cruise shuttle , it had to be requested before 23.00 the previous evening !!! The breakfast was Ok but we were relieved that we had booked only for one night (luckily) before our cruise . A week later we stayed in Hampton Inn Coconut Grove the same price class and that is Excellant value for the price !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Marypp9595
Reviews.Content: When I walked in it was not what I expected. The lobby was small and it was people everyone checking in and out. I got checked in by the friendly staff had a few laughs with him. Got to the ancient elevator and thought it was cute how they have a man help you up and down. The room was ok not the four seasons, but very clean. I felt comfortable. We were a five minute walk to bayside, hardrock, american airllines arena, 24hr walgreens and much more that was all I needed. They also gave us a free shuttle to the port I think it only runs once a day. If they can have run a little longer that would be great. Overall I was happy what I paid for the room I didnt expect a whole lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: jefe357
Reviews.Content: No one would confuse the Leamington Hotel for a luxury resort, but it serves it's purpose well - perfect for anyone who wants a cheap, no-frills hotel in downtown Miami. The facilities are what I would call "very adequate". The beds and bathrooms were clean - no signs of bugs or anything like that. There was no clock in the room, and the lock on the bathroom didn't quite work. The "free continental breakfast" is essentially a pot of coffee and a loaf of white bread. The television gets about a dozen channels. All in all, this hotel got the job done - for an extremely low price, I got what I needed and nothing more: a room with a clean bed and shower. As far as location goes, you're in close walking distance to the ocean (but not to the beach), as well as other areas of downtown Miami. The north side of the neighborhood can feel a little sketchy at night, but at no point did I feel unsafe. There is a handful of restaurants and bars within a 5-10 minute walk, as well as a 24-hour Walgreen's. If you're looking for frills, this isn't the place for you. But there's nothing "bad" about the Leamington. There's just nothing spectacular about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Very disorganized and rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous51117
Reviews.Content: Had to wait over two hours for our room. Not enough staff all the way around. The worst experience ever. Don't do it!! The pictures on the website are faked as the hotel is old and shabby looking. The "continental breakfast" ' was some stale muffins. The staff was the rudest I have every seen in the service industry. Parking was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “I bet Hell is nicer”
Reviews.Author: rexfps
Reviews.Content: There are no words that can describe this over $100 a night hotel in Miami. The guy I saw down the street sleeping on the parking bench was nicer than my bed. I woke up with wire cutting into my leg I pulled the blanket off and there was a black rusty wire coming through the mattress. The bed was covered in Urine, blood, and I am sorry did not have a scope with me but I am sure there was more bacteria to make tons of people sick. There was cat poop in the cornor of the room. The bathroom would not close I asked for 3 rooms the guy gave me one room and another called a family room stated i had to share this so called family room with another couple, we had to even share the bathroom 2 people wouldnt even take a shower it was so bad, urine covered floors and semen covered walls is what you will get at this place. I have stayed in some bad places but this has to be the worst place in the us to stay. I complained to the guy downstairs he just said so sorry you can email the owner if you like. There is nothing I can do. I also stated I needed ride to airport since they offered this, he stated we do its at 10 am every day and 3pm . This place is such a fraud.

Reviews.Title: “It will get the job done, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: sweetz01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to our cruise and loved the location!!!! If your looking for a place to sleep for one night maybe two close to restaurant, bars night clubs, shopping without spending a arm and a leg this is the place BAYSIDE MARKET PLACE is a walk away literally 2 blocks with lots of shopping, restaurants, bars, live outdoors music and an ocenview that is beautiful its no 5 star hotel with 500 thread count sheets no microwave or refrigerator but LOCATION is GREAT and it has a bed, bathroom, shower, sink and closet all we did was sleep and shower in our room its no resort but it gets the job done and the port or Miami is just over the bridge

Reviews.Title: “DONT EVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: trvlr8361
Reviews.Content: Always remember you will get what you pay for there is a reason why this place is so cheap!! IT WAS HORRIBLE, to the point where we could not stay in the hotel we checked in and shortly there after checked out and booked another hotel. The room door handles fell off there was a deadbolt which locked the door yes but the staff downstairs kept one set of keys because they couldn't find it...yea real safe! The bathroom had NOTHING in it the beds had stains on the sheets and just the general appearance of the hallways and carpets looked like you'd leave there with some sort of disease. The breakfast offered downstairs was out when we arrived and it looked as if bugs were going to come out of the baskets the smell was horrible as well. Not to mention the thugish looking groups of guys constantly outside the hotel doors. Overall just not a good location nor hotel. The only positive was the receptionist we spoke with was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “DONT DO IT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: babyshae
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel ever to start off the the stay you had to pay for room up front they didnt have any more single rooms available so they gave me a a double room, no problem. Our room was on the second floor they had one shaft elevator that looked like it was from the 1940s.i thought we were going to get stuck on it just going up one floor, once u get off the elevator your in a hallway with dim lighting, dirty walls, and old carpet. The room didnt have the electonic locks. The room was worse than the hallway very small, one window in the room and in the bathroom and u couldnt see out or open either one of the windows because they were painted shut. They said, they only changed the sheets and towels if u left them on the floor but they rever changed the two nights we were there. The grand finally of it all is that they advertise free continental breakfast for guest only but only thing they served was toast and coffee (what about the people who dont drink coffee). You coudn't pay me to ever stay here again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Santoes is the Best”
Reviews.Author: EaglePhoenix62
Reviews.Content: The only thing that was a bit intimidating during our week stay was the problem and expense of parking.The Hotel it's self has been transformed.We stayed on the 4th floor in a Family room.Two entrances.It was spotless.Old and spotless :) The building is from the early 30's and the elevator with sliding caged door was unique. There are a few bums that like to hang out front,but we actually found they were homeless and not all that bad.Of course we were cautious. It is center Miami so very convenient to Walgreen's,C VS, Bay front Park,Night life,and the FREE transport Metro-rail Mover. There is a 24 Hour Latino Cafe on the corner adjacent to the Hotel and it was a lifesaver.The weather was very cold in the mid to upper 30's so a cup of Hot chocolate sure hit the right spot.The Cuban sandwich was also excellent. Santos was on the spot when ever we needed him,very sweet and concerned about our welfare and being comfortable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away. Not fit for humans or animals...”
Reviews.Author: char1224
Reviews.Content: This hotel was referred to us by Hotels.com. I was told that this was a very nice hotel, one of their best in a good location. Be very careful with these referrals because they only go on what the hotels tells them. I knew we were in trouble when a dirty bum greeted us as we exited the taxie and begin washing the tires with a dirty spray bottle of something as he asked for a "dollar" . As we proceeded to the lobby the bum insisted on grabbing our luggage again asking for a "dollar". The lobby was smelly with a host of misfits standing around glaring at us. The elevelator was ancient like the one on Petty Coat Junction (about 50 years old) and bumped and grinded the entire time we were scared to get in. As we entered the hotel room I simply wanted to cry but was too angry. The comforter and sheets on the beds were dirty, dingy and stained with old blood mixed with other STUFF. The carpets was stained with what looked like old gum and feces. Dust and dirt everywhere plus a little extra in the corners. Holes in the walls, blinds dirty and did not work. the air conditioner blew musty air, bathroom simply filthy. I do not believe the bathtub has ever been cleaned shower curtins torn and dirty. I contacted Hotels.com and informed them of the conditions and asked to be moved to a different location, however there was none.. I complained to the Manager and he acted surprised that I didnt like his hotel. And they have the nerve to offer continential breakfast. Eat at your own ristk Better yet, stay away. I took pictures to send to Hotels.com. I'd be very interested in knowing if they still refer this hotel as one of their best.

Reviews.Title: “Get a Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: Jenla68
Reviews.Content: As the saying goes...you get what you pay! Agent sold me on 'upgrading' to one of the 4th floor 'newly' refurbished adjoining Family rooms - A/C not working, deadbolt wouldn't lock with key from outside on main door, no dresser, no table, no sitting area, no remote for TV, rusty shower head and a great view of a drug dealer getting arrested in the back alley. Moved to new room with working A/C and 1 non-working TV. PLUSES No Alarm clock necessary - room faced delivery alley, commuter tram, and transit bus stop. Woke at 6:30 am to garbage truck, semi backing up and bus air brakes. Pay the extra money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Claen & Basic”
Reviews.Author: pakman61
Reviews.Content: The Lemmington is clean and basic. Close to the Bayside Market. We choose this hotel for its price and proximity to the cruise port.Great for those using public transportation. We checked in around 3:00PM the night before our cruise. Then quickly walked over to the Bayside market for the evening. We had a great time at Bayside with its live entertainment. The area looks like it could be a little rough but we were back in our room by 9:00 PM . Everything was dated but clean; Yes; it needed some remodeling but we dont mind. The next day you are going to be on a cruise ship. The bathroom smelled like bleach but to us it was proof they did a good job cleaning. I sure would not book here for a honeymoon; but we have traveled all over central and south america so we dont mind a little dated decor. I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “The simplicity for a day or so”
Reviews.Author: haitifaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in 2005 and 2006 twice, and I spent two days there, each time. You notice from the beginning that is a very old site but it's cute and clean, and the prices for the location is very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It !”
Reviews.Author: djdep
Reviews.Content: Ok lets be honest. This must be the absolute worse hotel that I have ever been in. I was referred to this dump due to another hotel being sold out and they used the Leamington as a satellite hotel. Needless to say, I complained everyday until I was reimbursed by the host hotel. Lets start with the staff they were rude, uncaring and simply misersable. The lobby is used as a transport station for packages being sent to Haiti. They have people packing and tapeing boxes all day and night and it smells horrible inside. I understand vintage, but this is a building that should have been blown away with one of the big hurricanes that Florida had. Please dont be fooled by the three circle rating. After all they are circles not stars. This is a pet hotel and only if your really mad at your pet. A great practical joke if your into those things. Sleep on the street before staying here its cleaner. They should apply for a grant so this hotel can be used as a homeless shelter.

Reviews.Title: “intrersting”
Reviews.Author: reggae5
Reviews.Content: Read reviews, Just need a cheap place to stay for a night in Miami Finally found it, parked the car around the corner on the street, The hotel was VERY basic but clean and interesting, We wonder what it would of looked like int the 30's in it's prime! Bottom line!! we would stay there again , LOVED the price and it was funky , around the corner you can spend ten times the price

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First the positive. Cheap, clean, close to Bayside Marketplace and marina, handy for buses to Miami Beach and Metro. BUT very basic, small en suite rooms with TV and aircon. Looking tired. Ancient elevator. No facilities. Needs refurbishment. It's OK but you wouldn't want to stay there for more than a day or two.

HotelInfo.Name: Leamington Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 307 NE 1st Street, Miami, FL 33132
